results.title: Just an idea
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Editorial Film Productions, James Mellor and Guy Blanchard
results.brief_description: The many sources of technical information available to British industry, including research associations, technical libraries, and the constituent organisations of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research. The film illustrates how the owner of an engineering firm solves a production problem with the help of valuable technical information obtained from these sources.

results.title: Just an accident
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV and Carol Haslam
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
Concerned with the experimental investigation of human factors in road accident causation. Considers individual differences in hazard perception, the problem of where the driver pays attention within the visual field, and how the driver deals with a hazard which has been seen.

results.title: Just a trace
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Shan Benson and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: Just a trace of some element - cobalt, copper, or molybdenum can give rich pasture and healthy sheep where until recently the desert defied the farmer. The film shows how South Australian areas once fit only for scrub have been transformed into prosperous farms. Many countries, as well as Australia, are now benefiting from the important research work in this field undertaken by Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation.

results.title: Just a story
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Barbara Boyd-Anderson, Tony Paice and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: An attempt to show that storytelling is not just part of literature but is part of the everyday world around us and the ways in which we relate to each other. Demonstrates that our own experiences provide a rich source of information which may be drawn upon for the writing of stories.

results.title: Just a short story (A)
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, Keith Salvat and Bevon Peddell
results.brief_description: This is a true story based on the Australia’s Stolen Generation. It is an animated account of the disintegration of an Aboriginal family on Menindee Mission in 1947. The story is told and narrated by Aunty Beryl Carmichael.

results.title: Just a patch of scrub
results.creator_credit: World Wide Fund for Nature Australia
results.brief_description: Overviews traditional problems with the land including clearing, soil erosion and salinity. Discusses the importance of preserving and benefits of remnant native vegetation and shows the revegatation of a wasteland area where land had been cleared. Includes comprehensive teaching notes.

results.title: Just a little love song
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault and Viviane Elnecave
results.brief_description: This particular love song is an ironic, oftentimes caustic, commentary on the terror and pain of love, from a child’s desperate attempts at closeness with his parents to an adult’s relationship with a cruel and isolating world. Animated boldly with a paint brush and black ink, the action, like a continual dance, throbs to the rhythms of a five-string banjo. Shapes change, are metamorphosed, in an emotional roller-coaster trip through the subconscious. Banjo music by Peter Seeger from the ‘Goofing-off Suite’ by Gerry Goodfriend. Photography by Raymond Dumas.

results.title: Just a lady
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew, Kathleen Shannon and Susan Trow
results.brief_description: A photographic journal covering one hundred and fifty years, showing the women of an upper-class Canadian family. Starting with an early immigrant family, the film gradually narrows its focus from yesterday’s women, who lived secure, comfortable lives tied into rigid social patterns, to today’s women and the choices that face them. A search for roots and meaning that is both personal and historical. Photography by Susan Trow and Gilles Tremblay and Richard Moras. Edited by Susan Trow. Music by Sharon Smith. Sound by Bruce Mackay and Alain Clavier.

results.title: Just-a-minute
results.brief_description: Just a-minute was a training program organised by Studio D of the National Film Board of Canada in collaboration with the Women’s Program, Department of the Secretary of State. This program gave Canadian women an opportunity to express themselves through the medium of a one minute film clip. Through humour, caricature, or animation, the clips highlight some of the problems or attitudes encountered by women at home and at work. Entertaining to watch, the films do not disguise the pertinence of their contents.

results.title: Just
results.brief_description: In a room above a street, Radiohead play their song, ‘Just’. In the street below, a man lies on the ground, attracting a number of concerned, irritated and worried passers-by. But his condition may be contagious…..
